radiographic_examinations.findings: Stones in the distended gallbladder with thickened wall. The hepatic parenchyma appears mildly echogenic. There is no focal liver mass. Main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. No intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CBD measures 5 mm. The pancreas was not well visualized due to overlying bowel gas. Normal echogenicity of the spleen, measuring 11 cm. Limited views of the bilateral kidneys demonstrate no hydronephrosis or stones.
